::: {.cell}

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: M3.6.web.orig v1.0.


> Major occurrences of Hadal trenches and troughs was based on the ‘hadal’ and ‘trenches’ geomorphic units of Harris et al. (2014b). Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M3_6_web_orig))
 - Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090986))
 - Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M3.6 Hadal trenches and troughs**](/efg-info/M3_6.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Indicative Map (**code: M3.6.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: M3.6.web.orig**, version v1.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

M3.6.IM.orig (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M3.6.IM.orig_v1.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934)
M3.6.web.orig (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M3.6.web.orig_v1.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419) :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090986) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M3_6_web_orig) :: [GitHub repository](layers/M3.6.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json) :: [GitHub repository](M3.6.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json) :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
